explanations.summary: H+-K+-ATPase is expressed in INTERCALATED cells (type A) of collecting duct. Used for H+ secretion and K+ reabsorption during hypokalemia. Principal cells have ENaC/ROMK, not H-K pump.

whyCorrect.a: Intercalated cells (type A) in collecting duct express H+-K+-ATPase for acid secretion and K+ reabsorption.

whyIncorrect.b: Proximal tubule uses Na+-H+ exchanger (NHE3), not H-K pump.
whyIncorrect.c: Principal cells have ENaC and ROMK, not H-K pump.
whyIncorrect.d: Distal tubule early segment doesn't have H-K pump.
whyIncorrect.e: Thick ascending limb has NKCC2, not H-K pump.

explanations.summary: Partially compensated metabolic acidosis: low pH, low HCO3- (primary), low pCO2 (respiratory compensation but incomplete). Option D shows pH 7.25, HCO3- 15mM (low=metabolic acidosis), pCO2 35 (low=respiratory compensation).

whyCorrect.d: pCO2=35, HCO3-=15, pH=7.25: Primary is low HCO3- (metabolic acidosis). pCO2 is low (respiratory compensation) but pH still acidotic=partial compensation.

whyIncorrect.a: High pCO2 and HCO3- with high pH = respiratory acidosis with metabolic compensation or metabolic alkalosis.
whyIncorrect.b: High pCO2 with normal HCO3- = respiratory acidosis.
whyIncorrect.c: High pCO2 with high HCO3- and normal pH = compensated respiratory acidosis.
whyIncorrect.e: Low pCO2 with low HCO3- but high pH = respiratory alkalosis.

explanations.summary: Vacuolar H+-ATPase (V-ATPase) is in INTERCALATED cells of collecting duct (both type A and B). Used for H+ secretion into lumen. Different from H+-K+-ATPase.

whyCorrect.c: Intercalated cells in collecting duct express vacuolar H+-ATPase (V-type) on apical membrane for proton secretion.

whyIncorrect.a: Proximal tubule uses NHE3, not vacuolar H-pump.
whyIncorrect.b: Principal cells secrete K+ and reabsorb Na+, not H+.
whyIncorrect.d: Distal tubule early segment doesn't have prominent H-pump.
whyIncorrect.e: Thick ascending limb has NKCC2, minimal H-ATPase.
